text: Natalia Harris (1996 – May 7, 2020) was an American model, actress, and author. She survived bone cancer aged 12, and went on to become a fashion model for leading brands and agencies. == Early life == Harris is the daughter of Dr. Egli Colon Stephens. She was born in New York and attended Eleanor Roosevelt High School. In 2008, at the age of 12, Harris was diagnosed with osteosarcoma, a bone cancer, in her leg. She underwent chemotherapy and had to relearn how to walk with an internal titanium prosthetic. == Modeling career == Despite her diagnosis, Harris fulfilled her dream of becoming a model and walking the runway. She was represented by State Management modeling agency and walked at the Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week in Lincoln Center in New York. She was a model for Foot Locker, Delta, and Laura Mercier beauty products. In 2019, she was featured on the cover of Vogue Knitting magazine. She was included in Project Runway a few times and had a role in the off-Broadway production of Annie Warbucks. == Publications == In 2019, Harris co-authored a book, Unbroken: A Mother-Daughter Journey of Resilience, Faith and Courage, with her mother. == Death == Harris died in May 2020 from renal medullary carcinoma, a kidney cancer that is carried by those with the sickle cell trait. == References == Category:American female models Category:African- American models Category:1996 births Category:2020 deaths Category:African- American female models Category:Place of death missing Category:American actresses Category:Female models from New York (state)
title: Natalia Harris
